div.head: William Brookes Will
div.p:
Province Maryland Charles County. In the name of God Amen
To all Christian people Know yee that I William Brookes planter
and now in my perfect sense and meory desire that I have my
last
last will and testament to bee performed & done after my departiene of this
life to the under mentioned and that they may and peacably
injoy what I freely give and bequeath unto then in consideration that
Giles Tomkins shall oat my Leavey and my dent due to Matter Danis
which is one hundred and thirty three pounds of Tobacco being all the debts
that I doe owe firsthen moon that the above said Giles Tomkins shall
give me a decent bureall.

Item. I doe give and bequeath unto my loving friend Goles Tomkins one
gray mare and fole being in his possession and all my debts that is due unto me in
Maryland that is to say by a debt due to me from John Ewlson from my
crappe to the value of one thousand four hundred and fifty pounds of good
Tobacco also debt due to me from John Hodgeon being fr Labour done by
me to the value of seven hundred and ninety pounds of good Tobacco.

Item. I doe freely give and bequeath unto my trusty and well beloved friend
John Mueton planter my servant Igy by name Edward Brides & now
being in his possession for his full time of time he had to serve me this being
my free will I doe further acknowledge this to be my last will and testament
as witness my hand and seal the sixteene day of November one thousand
six hundred and seventy eight.

Signed Sealed and Delivered
In the presense of us
Henry Hardy - Thomas Sanders
his
Jacob Sterne - Ralph Shelley
mark
In mark of
William W Brookes

On the back of the aforegoing will was the following probate (to will)
February 11th 1678. Then came before me. Henry Hard and Jacon Sterne.
and did Declare upon oath that they saw the within mentioned
William Brookes signe and seal the within mentioned will as his last
will and testament
3 1/4 sides
Hum. Marren
